static int execUnitexTool(java.lang.String cmdline)
          Function to run UnitexTool with string or string array, like java exec in java runtime
you can combine several tool using { }
(see UnitexTool in Unitex manual for more information)
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool("UnitexTool Normalize \"corpus.txt\" -r \"Norm.txt\"");
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool("UnitexTool Tokenize \"corpus.txt\" -a \"Alphabet.txt\"");
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool("UnitexTool { Normalize \"corpus.txt\" -r \"Norm.txt\" } { Tokenize \"corpus.txt\" -a \"Alphabet.txt\" }");
static int execUnitexTool(java.lang.String[] cmdarray)
          Function to run UnitexTool with string or string array, like java exec in java runtime
you can combine several tool using { }
(see UnitexTool in Unitex manual for more information)
String [] strArrayCmds={"UnitexTool","{","Normalize","corpus.txt", "-r", "Norm.txt","}","{","Tokenize","corpus.txt", "-r", "Alphabet.txt","}"};
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool(strArrayCmds);

execUnitexTool

public static int execUnitexTool(java.lang.String[] cmdarray)
Function to run UnitexTool with string or string array, like java exec in java runtime
you can combine several tool using { }
(see UnitexTool in Unitex manual for more information)
String [] strArrayCmds={"UnitexTool","{","Normalize","corpus.txt", "-r", "Norm.txt","}","{","Tokenize","corpus.txt", "-r", "Alphabet.txt","}"};
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool(strArrayCmds);

Returns:
value : the return value of the tools (0 for success)

execUnitexTool

public static int execUnitexTool(java.lang.String cmdline)
Function to run UnitexTool with string or string array, like java exec in java runtime
you can combine several tool using { }
(see UnitexTool in Unitex manual for more information)
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool("UnitexTool Normalize \"corpus.txt\" -r \"Norm.txt\"");
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool("UnitexTool Tokenize \"corpus.txt\" -a \"Alphabet.txt\"");
UnitexLibAndJni.execUnitexTool("UnitexTool { Normalize \"corpus.txt\" -r \"Norm.txt\" } { Tokenize \"corpus.txt\" -a \"Alphabet.txt\" }");

Returns:
value : the return value of the tools (0 for success)

usingOffsetFile

public static boolean usingOffsetFile()
function to check the compatibility of Unitex with offset file

Returns:
true for version of Unitex which uses file offset (stating Unitex 3.0)

numberAbstractFileSpaceInstalled

public static int numberAbstractFileSpaceInstalled()
function to known how many abstract file system are installed

Returns:
the number of Abstract file system installed in Unitex

loadPersistentDictionary

public static java.lang.String loadPersistentDictionary(java.lang.String filename)
Note: The persistence mechanism uses file name comparisons to detect that a file has already been loaded. So, you must use the exact same file name returned by load function, even if your system is case tolerant
